title: Who was the real ‘Sammie’ who The Circle’s James was catfishing as?
text:
James spent the series pretending to be single mum ‘Sammie’ (Picture: Channel 4)

The Circle is over for another year, but while the dust might have settled on the final we just can’t stop talking about the Channel 4 show.

And one question which just keeps coming up time and time again concerns last catfish standing James – who did such a good job pretending to be single mum Sammie that he shocked everyone when he revealed on Friday night who he really was.

But just who is ‘Sammie’ in real life – and does the person he claimed to be in his photos have any connection to her?

Here’s what you need to know…

Who was the real Sammie who James played as in The Circle?

The real identity of ‘Sammie’ – as featured in James’ profile photo on the show – has not been revealed.

In fact James admitted during Friday night’s final that he ‘didn’t know the girl’ – but later told Digital Spy that her identity was nearly very different.

Advertisement

Advertisement

“It was originally based on somebody very, very close to me, but towards the end it was decided I was not gonna use them photos,’ he explained.

“The person who it was would have been too uncomfortable. But they [the producers] still wanted me on there and I was given an option to use somebody I didn’t know.

James told metro.co.uk he would be keen to meet the real Sammie, adding that he doesn’t ‘think there are any single mums that dislike what I’ve done or disliked me, they understand’.

James almost based the character on someone he knew (Picture: PA)

Having been branded ‘a very naughty boy’ by Tim after they learned the truth about his identity, James explained to the others why he played as ‘Sammie’ and not as himself.

‘The reason I went as a single mum is, I thought, “Who do I adore more than anyone in the world?” and it’s my mum. She raised me on my own.

‘I did it for all the right reasons. If my mum never had to worry about another bill, that’s everything to me.

Who won The Circle final?

Sorry, this video isn't available any more.

The final was won by Paddy Smyth, who nabbed a £70,000 prize after being voted the most popular contestant by his fellow players.

However the public vote was won by Tim, who went home £30,000 richer after proving the viewers’ favourite.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: James made it to the final of The Circle - but just who was the real 'Sammie', who he catfished as during the series?
